page.title: 05FARMING:TYPICAL ANNUAL CYCLE
page.content: {Corn for Animal Feed In November and December the ground is ploughed.In March and April the soil is harrowed to make a seed bed.After that, a combine drill drills the manure and corn.Then the ground is rolled to make it firm. After the crop has grown its third leaf,it is sprayed for weeds and disease and it is left to ripen.It is harvested by a combine harvester in July and August.The combine threshes the corn and cleans it and the straw is left for the baler.The corn is then sent through the drier where it is dried until the moisture is about 12-15%,and then it is stored.In November it is milled through a crusher,protein is mixed with it and it is used to feed the livestock.The straw is used for bedding.Most of the corn grown is barley or wheat.(cont. on P.6)
